So, the probability of both players making quads on the river is approximately (0.0217)^2, or 0.00047189, or about 1 in 2,100.

Therefore, the overall probability of quads against quads in heads-up Texas Hold'em is the sum of these three probabilities, which is approximately 0.00049819, or about 1 in 2,007.
